Package crops

Class Crop

java.lang.Object
farm.FarmItem
crops.Crop
Direct Known Subclasses:
Cactus, Melon, Mushroom, Pumpkin, SugarCane, Wheat
public abstract class Crop
extends FarmItem
Logic and structure superclass to construct different crops.

This class provides each crop with the logic and structure required, by expanding on the FarmItem structure.
Crops grow daily and can be harvested to receive income. Income is calculated proportionally to crop growth (harvest()).

Version:
1.0
Author:
Alex Burling(arb142)
See Also:
Cactus, Melon, Mushroom, Pumpkin, SugarCane, Wheat

  • Constructor Details

    • Crop

      public Crop​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description, float price, float income, FarmItem.FarmItems selfEnum, int growTime)
      Constructs the Crop from the FarmItem constructor and crop specific values (income, grown). Grown is always initialized to 0 and as such is not a param.
      Parameters:
      name - Crop name, used when viewing status of item e.g. Wheat, Melon
      description - Crop description, used when viewing status of item
      price - Crop price, used when buying or selling to store
      income - Crop income, used when crop is harvested
      selfEnum - holds the enum representing the object for easier cloning
      growTime - int used to set and check when the crop is fully grown

  • Method Details

    • getIncome

      public float getIncome()
      How much will the player receive when they harvest the crop?
      Returns:
      income

    • isGrown

      public boolean isGrown()
      Is the crop fully grown?
      Returns:
      grown

    • getGrowth

      public float getGrowth()
      How much has the crop grown?
      Returns:
      growth

    • getGrowTime

      public int getGrowTime()
      How many days will it take for the crop to grow? (if no multiplier)
      Returns:
      growTime

    • endDay

      public void endDay()
      Handles end of the day actions for Crop objects

      Every FarmItem subclass must implement an endDay() function, to simplify game loop. This is to handle crop specific logic and attributes.
      i.e. natural plant growth

      Specified by:
      endDay in class FarmItem

    • harvest

      public void harvest()
      Updates Farm inventory and Farmer cash consistent with harvesting and selling as a daily action

      i.e. removes crop from the farm and adds money proportional to it's growth.

    • tend

      public void tend()
      Updates object attributes consistent with tending the crop as a daily action

      This function takes no parameters, and acts as standard tending. i.e. increases growth of crop at no cost.
      To tend with a growth item, call with Item as parameter (tend(Item))

    • tend

      public void tend​(Item item) throws InvalidItemException
      Updates object attributes consistent with tending the crop with an item as a daily action

      This function takes one item, to be consumed. i.e. increases growth of crop multiplied by item modifier (Item.getMod())
      To play without a growth item, call without Item as parameter (tend())

      Parameters:
      item - FarmItem to use while playing
      Throws:
      InvalidItemException - if (Item.getEffect()) != "growth"
